title: 3.2. Creating Jobs
intro: As explained in the Introduction to this section, Jobs are created by using the FieldLogs platform to acquire data, either Running a Template or Running 'Ad-hoc'. In this section we will explain in more detail the difference between the two and provide some examples of how to create Jobs.

blocks.content: Jobs can be created on all FieldLogs apps, across our supported clients (iOS, Android & our website). Jobs started while online are immediately and continuously synchronized to the Cloud, allowing such features as following a live Job in Real-Time. Jobs started while a device is offline (iOS & Android only) is stored locally until such moment that the device is back online. At which point, the Job is synchronized to the Cloud.
3.2.1.1. Creating a Job based on a Template on the Web

The recommended way to create Jobs in FieldLogs is to Run a Template. This process takes a Template definition and asks the User running the Job to answer it's various Inputs and Steps in the order specified in the Template, recording the answers and optional media as a Job. The benefit of this is that all contextual information about a Job done is attached to the Job so a User can go back and view all key information such as which Template was used, when what the Job completed and a range of meta-data.

Once the Job has started and you are in the state 'Running' (or 'Live') you will be taken to the Job Viewer screen indicating you can action on the Template and start recording data for inclusion in the Job. When you are done, simply clicking Stop will end the current Job.

As you answer Inputs on the Template, your validated answers will be correlated with GPS points added to the map. These may not be very visible unless you are moving, in which case you will see a red line showing your movements.

Jobs that are completed (or even currently Running) are listed on the Jobs section. This can be accessed on at the top from the Jobs menu item or on the Apps using relevant menu items. From here there are wide variety of actions available for administering your Jobs including a global map to see where they were created.
For more information about all the different actions, see the 'Accessing the Jobs List' section.
3.2.1.2. Creating a Job based on a Template on mobile devices

blocks.caption: Creating Jobs based on Templates on the mobile devices can be done from the Templates screen by selecting a desired Template that you want to Run (create a Job from) and selecting the Action 'Run' from the Action menu that pops in from the right hand side. This will automatically create a new Job and start acquisition on your mobile device.

Much like on the website, the mobile app presents the User with the Template Definition that can be answered and the responses recorded inside the Job.

Options related to the Running of Jobs and other App-wide specific actions can be accessed in the Menu by tapping the FieldLogs logo at the top of the screen.
On the Menu panel there exists a range of quick shortcuts to different Actions related to a Users context. Here there is a clearly labelled button to allow a User to stop the currently Running Job

blocks.content: This Menu is available throughout the app making it easy to Stop a Running Job even if you are on a different section.

blocks.caption: Just as on the web, a Job in the Job List indicates whether or not it has been created using a Template by including the Template title below the main Job title.

blocks.content: A Job that has been created from a Template, is automatically given the same name as the Template used to create it if no other name is given.

Ad-hoc Jobs are Jobs that have been created without a Template. They exist solely as a way to track GPS and Logs between a start and stop point. Ad-hoc Jobs can be useful for simple documentation of a Job being performed rather than expecting a procedure to be adhered to, as per a Template. As an example, this might be useful to document an experimental repair procedure or for location scouting.
Ad-hoc Jobs can only be created on mobile devices running the FieldLogs app. They cannot be created on the Web.

blocks.caption:
Ad-hoc Jobs are most commonly started from the Ad-hoc Tab on the App. A Job can be started in 2 ways. To quickly start an Ad-hoc Job, a User can simple start by creating a Log (media item) from the choices on the right side of the map. This will automatically start GPS acquisition and the Job.

Another way to start an Ad-hoc Job is to go through the global menu (Point 3.)

Once the Menu is open you will see an option to 'Start new Job'.

GPS Mode
An additional option available to Users running both Ad-hoc and Template-based Jobs is a global setting in the Menu allowing the switch between 'Step-by-Step' acquisition and 'Continuous' acquisition.
'Step-by-Step' acquisition only acquires GPS data points when the User either creates a Log or validates a Step in a Template. This mode helps to save on device battery power and is recommended for long Jobs where a clear GPS route may not be as important. 'Continuous' acquires GPS points automatically and continuously leading to a clear GPS 'track' on the map.
